agenda.description: ** REVISION ** SENATE NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Property Tax TIME & DATE: 3:00 PM or upon adjournment Tuesday, April 16, 2019 PLACE: 2E.20 (Betty King Cmte. Rm.) CHAIR: Senator Paul Bettencourt The Committee will meet to consider pending business and the following: SB 211 Flores Relating to the procedures for protests and appeals of certain ad valorem tax determinations. SB 701 Nichols | et al. Relating to the qualification of land for appraisal for ad valorem tax purposes as timber land or restricted-use timber land. SB 1090 Campbell Relating to the vote required to authorize the issuance of certain bonds. SB 1224 Bettencourt | et al. Relating to the election date for the authorization of the issuance of bonds. SB 1285 Bettencourt Relating to the procedure for the sale by auction of real property pursuant to foreclosure of a tax lien. SB 1309 Bettencourt Relating to the assessment and collection of ad valorem taxes imposed by a school district. SB 1361 Bettencourt Relating to the public resale by means of a public auction using online bidding and sale of property purchased by a taxing unit at an ad valorem tax sale. SB 1395 Seliger Relating to voter approval of a proposed ad valorem tax rate that exceeds the rollback tax rate. SB 1771 Bettencourt Relating to the ad valorem taxation of a leasehold or other possessory interest in certain property owned by a municipality. SB 1876 Fallon | et al. Relating to a request for binding arbitration to appeal appraisal review board orders involving two or more contiguous tracts of land. SB 1986 Creighton Relating to the selection and administration of an appraisal review board; authorizing a fee. SB 1987 Creighton Relating to the selection and administration of an appraisal review board in certain counties; authorizing a fee. SB 2083 Hinojosa Relating to the calculation of the ad valorem taxes imposed on property for the year in which the property is acquired by a governmental entity. SB 2337 Bettencourt Relating to the treatment of captured appraised value and tax increment in the calculation of ad valorem tax rates for a taxing unit. SB 2503 Bettencourt Relating to the calculation of the rollback tax rate of a school district. SB 2544 Menéndez Relating to deferred collection of ad valorem taxes on certain residence homesteads. Public testimony will be limited to 3 minutes. If submitting written testimony, please provide 20 copies to the committee clerk with your name and bill number on each copy. You may register for this hearing using the Senate kiosk located in the extension hallways, outside the committee room, or by going to http://swrs. Bills added after last posting: SB 1395 SB 1876 SB 2544 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions of the schedule **
